intro: Morisonia valerabella, commonly known as the sweetroot or false ginseng, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous and has been historically used in traditional medicine. Morisonia valerabella is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its delicate foliage and early spring bloom.
